8. Morris wants to people to be aware of the impact of dumping garbage off wharves. He says it‚Äôs a major problem & out-of-sight shouldn‚Äôt mean out-of-mind. #DFONL #NLTrashTalk https://t.co/YA8bQAAXrL
7. Morris & Porter also found a lot of abandoned fishing gear near wharves. In this video, you can see it still fishing. #DFONL #NLTrashTalk https://t.co/I9gdsoGdGO
6. While it‚Äôs funny to see a diver riding a bicycle, it‚Äôs not funny that Morris & Porter found bicycles dumped in most harbours they surveyed. #DFONL #NLTrashTalk https://t.co/riHOXgOjFB
5. Morris & Porter recorded video of garbage as far as the eye could see. Note all the beer bottles & rubber boots. #DFONL #NLTrashTalk https://t.co/EW7m0rnKBb

4. Most of the ‚Äúmodern‚Äù garbage Morris & Porter found was within 20 metres of a wharf. Anything from carpet, rubber gloves & rubber boots to appliances like BBQs & stoves ‚Äì even a washer with a full load of laundry inside. #DFONL #NLTrashTalk https://t.co/5naxkVwpQW
